name: Conversation rewards
description: Generate rewards for on topic conversation for closing issues as complete.

evmNetworkId.description: Network ID to run in, default to 100

evmPrivateEncrypted.description: The encrypted key to use for permit generation and auto transfers

automaticTransferMode.description: If set to false or if there are insufficient funds to settle the payment, permits will be generated instead of processing direct payouts.

file.description: Specify a file to write the results in

requirePriceLabel.description: If set to false, the plugin runs even if the price label is missing, and will evaluate comments.

limitRewards.description: Should the rewards of non-assignees be limited to the task reward?

collaboratorOnlyPaymentInvocation.description: If false, will allow contributors to generate permits.

tokenCountLimit.description: Token count limit for a given model. If the content goes beyond the token limit, content will get truncated during evaluation.

maxRetries.description: Maximum number of retries to make

multipliers.description: Multipliers applied to different types of comments

role.description: Roles that this multiplier applies to

redeemTask.description: Is the task redeemable, e.g. can the user collect the bounty?

skipCommentsWhileAssigned.description:
Configures how user comments are included in the rewards calculation when they are assigned to a GitHub issue:

- 'all': Excludes all comments made between the first assignment start and the last assignment end, discouraging gaming by un-assigning and commenting for rewards.
- 'exact': Excludes only comments made during precise assignment periods, targeting times when the user is actively assigned.
- 'none': Includes all comments, regardless of assignment status or timing.

baseRate.description: Number of lines of code that equals $1 in review credit

conclusiveReviewCredit.description: Flat rate bonus in dollars for completing a conclusive review i.e (Approved or Changes Requested)

weight.description: Weight of readability score in the total formatting score

targetReadabilityScore.description: Ideal Flesch-Kincaid score (60-70 is considered ideal for general audience)

multipliers.description: Multipliers applied to different parts of the comment according the role of the author

role.description: The list of roles this multiplier applies to

multiplier.description: Multiplier for the given list of roles

score.description: Score per word in the entity

countWords.description: Whether to count words in the entity

wordCountExponent.description: Exponent applied to the word count total

post.description: Enables posting to the related GitHub Issue

debug.description: Enables debug by creating a local html file of the rendered comment

maxAttempts.description: The maximum amount of retries on failure

delayMs.description: The delay between each retry, in milliseconds
